intro: Beloperone scansilis, commonly known as the Madagascar starfish plant, is a unique species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and milky sap-producing plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers and fleshy, succulent leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the island's specific climate. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is often found in protected areas and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
